ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] FindBugs Community Review of Heritrix
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Steve I have established a weekly process that downloads and analyzes the latest 3.1.1 snapshot from the maven repository. So the warnings in the cloud

Hi Steve

I have established a weekly process that downloads and analyzes the 
latest 3.1.1 snapshot from the maven repository. So the warnings in the 
cloud should reflect the latest build, and will continue to be updated 
as you provide feedback through the review and/or fix issues.

Thanks,
Nat


On 4/16/2010 8:02 PM, steve@... wrote:
> hi Nat,
>
> our nightly builds for H3 are available here:
>
> http://builds.archive.org:8080/maven2/org/archive/heritrix/heritrix/3.1.1-SNAPSHOT/ 
>
>
> more information about our builds can be found on the wiki:
> https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Build+Box
>
> i've opened another issue for us to provide feedback for your
> research: https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1759
>
> thanks for the details on your analysis, that will help us include
> FindBugs in our build process at some point moving forward. i'll
> follow up with you later on how to connect our local analysis with the
> cloud if we decide to go that route.
>
> in the meantime, we'll take a closer look at the FindBugs analysis,
> and decide how best to provide feedback, and fix the most important
> bugs.
>
> /steve@...
>
>
> On 4/16/10 12:58 PM, Nat Ayewah wrote:
> > Hi Steve,
> >
> > Thanks for taking a look at this. One of our goals is to keep the cloud
> > updated with the state of the project (e.g. by analyzing the nightly
> > build). This is especially useful if you mark a warning as "Not-A-Bug",
> > so it can be suppressed, and this information is remembered.
> >
> > Perhaps the best short-term solution would be for you to point me to 
> the
> > build-artifacts produced after each nightly build. I can set up the
> > cloud to download, analyze, and update the cloud after each build.
> > Eventually can have the continuous build update the cloud directly.
> >
> > I have more specific answers to some of your queries below:
> >
> >> we'll need to learn
> >> how to tell FindBugs how to find "missing classes needed for
> >> analysis", and how to exclude "bugs" which we want ignored.
> >>
> > I ran the analysis on H3. My approach was to download
> > heritrix-3.0.0-dist.tar.gz, bundle all the jars, and separate out the
> > ones that contain analysis classes and auxillary classes. From the
> > command line, I use the following commands (assumes FindBugs is on the
> > path):
> >
> > find heritrix-3.0.0 -name "*.jar" > analysis.txt
> > rejarForAnalysis -inputFileList analysis.txt -auxFileList analysis.txt
> > -prefix org.archive
> >
> > This creates two jars 'analyze.jar' and 'auxilary.jar' that I use as my
> > analysis target and auxilary class path respectively. There may be some
> > classes missing -- FindBugs does a "best-effort" analysis and the
> > missing classes don't necessarily lead to lots of missing warnings.
> >
> > To exclude entire bug patterns, I would use a FindBugs filter file
> > described at: http://findbugs.sourceforge.net/manual/filter.html
> >
> >>
> >> i really like the FindBugs Eclipse plugin, but don't see a way
> >> to get "-emacs"-like output from it, and it doesn't look like
> >> annotations (in the Bug User Annotations view) can be uploaded
> >> to the cloud from the plugin.
> >>
> > The Eclipse plugin is currently being updated to support the new cloud
> > features.
> >>
> >>
> >> when i open the Web Start client, it says "not signed in", but
> >> the Comunity Review page says a seperate browser window will
> >> open to login with OpenId. is there another way to login to the
> >> review?
> >>
> > We recently changed the workflow so you do not need to sign in unless
> > you want to review a warning. When you try to do this, a message
> > prompting you to sign in comes up. I've updated the Community Review
> > page <http://findbugs.cs.umd.edu/cloud/> to reflect this.
> >>
> >>
> >> which version of Heritrix was analyzed to produce the bugs in
> >> the FindBugs Cloud? is there a way to see the options that were
> >> used to produce the cloud report for a particular project?
> >>
> > I analyzed heritrix-3.0.0. The warnings were filtered to only include
> > warnings with bug ranks 1-14 and with associated source files. The 
> exact
> > commands were:
> >
> > findbugs -textui -xml *-output db.xml* -auxclasspath auxilary.jar
> > analyze.jar
> > setBugDatabaseInfo -resetProject -purgeStats -findSource [srcdir]
> > *db.xml updated-db.xml*
> > filterBugs -withSource -maxRank 14 -priority M -dontUpdateStats
> > *updated-db.xml updated-db.xml*
> >
> >> it would be nice to reconcile the cloud bugs with the bugs i
> >> find with a local client, so we can track them together.
> >> otherwise, i'll need to open a seperate issue simply to provide
> >> feedback to the cloud for Community Review. do you have another
> >> recommendation?
> >>
> > We recently added features to FindBugs HEAD
> > <http://code.google.com/p/findbugs/source/browse/#svn/trunk/findbugs>
> > that allow you to connect your local analysis to the cloud. This is
> > still under development, but I can show you this if you are interested.
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Nat
